greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Inverse binomial transform of A144691.
comment: A144691 is defined by: A144691(n) = limit of the coefficient of x^(2^m+n) in B(x)^(n+1)/(n+1) as m grows, where B(x) = Sum_{k>=0} x^(2^k).
formula: G.f. A(x) satisfies: x/Series_Reversion(x*A(x)) = G(x) - x, so that G(x*A(x)) = (1+x)*A(x) and A(x/(G(x) - x)) = G(x) - x, where G(x) is the g.f. of A144692.
example: The g.f. G(x) of A144692 begins:
where G(x) satisfies: A(x) = G(x*A(x))/(1+x) and G(x) = A(x/(G(x)-x)) + x.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Dec 21 2011
